content.description: The diagram above shows the production possibilities curve for the production of peaches and apples in Fruitland.
content.question: The production possibilities curve illustrates which of the following relationships?

choices.label: The production of peaches decreases as apple production decreases.
The production of peaches increases as apple production increases.
The opportunity cost of peach production decreases as apple production decreases.
Fruitland cannot produce a combination of 5 units of peaches and 10 units of apples.

Fruitland can produce only the combinations of peaches and apples illustrated by points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></math>.

content.answer: Fruitland cannot produce a combination of 5 units of peaches and 10 units of apples.
